passage_text: The new iPhone 4 data plans limit the amount of 3G data you can use, and here is a tutorial outlining how to find out how much data you have used and how much you have left.

You can tap on System Services to see how much cellular data is used by system components that you can't prevent from using the cellular connection, like DNS services, Time & Location, Siri, mapping, networking, and such.

The most logical way to find how much iPhone data you have used is to utilize AT&T's website. Start by going here and logging on, provided that you have already created an online account with the website. This is a good practice either way because it will make bill management simpler.

1 You will receive a text message showing how much data you've used versus your monthly limit. 2  You can also download the My AT&T app to check your data usage. 3  T-Mobile-Dial #WEB# and press Send. 4  You will receive a text message showing how much data you've used versus your monthly limit. 5  Sprint-Dial *4

The list is sorted alphabetically, unfortunately, and not by cellular data consumption. But you can see how much data each app has used over your iPhone's cellular connection, and use the green slider to disable certain apps from using cellular data at all.

1 If you have the My Verizon app installed, the app will open and you can see your current data usage versus your monthly limit. 2  AT&T-Dial *DATA# and press Send. 3  You will receive a text message showing how much data you've used versus your monthly limit. 4  You can also download the My AT&T app to check your data usage.
